LABEL: AL rdfs:label@en
linkml description: AL linkml:description@en
data_collection_state: AT data_collection_state^^xsd:string
comments: AL linkml:comments@en

LABEL: amplicon pcr primer scheme
linkml description: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version of the primer scheme used to generate the amplicons for sequencing.

LABEL: amplicon size
linkml description: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.
comments: Guidance: Provide the amplicon size, including the units.

LABEL: anatomical material
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: A substance obtained from an anatomical part of an organism e.g. tissue, blood.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if an anatomical material was sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: anatomical part
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: An anatomical part of an organism e.g. oropharynx.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if an anatomical part was sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template. If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: authors
linkml description: Names of individuals contributing to the processes of sample collection, sequence generation, analysis, and data submission.
comments: Guidance: Include the first and last names of all individuals that should be attributed, separated by a comma.

LABEL: authors example
value: Tejinder Singh, Fei Hu, Joe Blogs

LABEL: bioinformatics protocol
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The name and version number of the bioinformatics protocol used.
comments: Guidance: Further details regarding the methods used to process raw data, and/or generate assemblies, and/or generate consensus sequences can be provided in an SOP or protocol. Provide the name and version number of the protocol.

LABEL: biomaterial extracted
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The biomaterial extracted from samples for the purpose of sequencing.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the biomaterial extracted from the picklist in the template.

LABEL: bioproject accession
linkml description: The INSDC accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
comments: Guidance: Store the BioProject accession number. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. Each province will be assigned a different bioproject accession number by the National Microbiology Lab. A valid NCBI BioProject accession has prefix PRJN e.g., PRJNA12345, and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project.

LABEL: biosample accession
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC archives.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN.

LABEL: body product
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: A substance excreted/secreted from an organism e.g. feces, urine, sweat.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if a body product was sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template.  If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: breadth of coverage value
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The percentage of the reference genome covered by the sequenced data, to a prescribed depth.
comments: Guidance: Provide value as a percent.

LABEL: collection device
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The instrument or container used to collect the sample e.g. swab.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if a device was used for sampling. Use the picklist provided in the template. If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: collection method
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The process used to collect the sample e.g. phlebotamy, necropsy.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if a collection method was used for sampling. Use the picklist provided in the template.  If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: collection protocol
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The name and version of a particular protocol used for sampling.
comments: Guidance: Free text.

LABEL: complications
linkml description: Patient medical complications that are believed to have occurred as a result of host disease.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select all of the complications experienced by the host from the pick list. If the desired term is missing, contact the curation team.

LABEL: consensus genome length
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: Size of the reconstructed genome described as the number of base pairs.
comments: Guidance: Provide a numerical value (no need to include units).

LABEL: consensus sequence filename
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The name of the consensus sequence file.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version number of the consensus sequence FASTA file.

LABEL: consensus sequence filepath
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The filepath of the consesnsus sequence file.
comments: Guidance: Provide the filepath of the consensus sequence FASTA file.

LABEL: consensus sequence name
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The name of the consensus sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version number of the consensus sequence.

LABEL: consensus sequence software name
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The name of software used to generate the consensus sequence.The name of software used to generate the consensus sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

LABEL: consensus sequence software version
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide the version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

LABEL: DataHarmonizer provenance
linkml description: The DataHarmonizer software version provenance.
comments: Guidance: The current software version information will be automatically generated in this field after the user utilizes the \"validate\" function. This information will be generated regardless as to whether the row is valid of not.

LABEL: dehosting method
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The method used to remove host reads from the pathogen sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version number of the software used to remove host reads.

LABEL: depth of coverage threshold
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the depth of coverage.
comments: Guidance: Provide the threshold fold coverage.

LABEL: depth of coverage value
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide value as a fold of coverage.

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (city)
linkml description: The name of the city that was the destination of most recent travel.
examples: destination of most recent travel (city) example
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the city that the host travelled to. Use this look-up service to identify the standardized term: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (city) example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:destination of most recent travel (city) example

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (country)
linkml description: The name of the country that was the destination of most recent travel.
examples: destination of most recent travel (country) example
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the country that the host travelled to. Use this look-up service to identify the standardized term: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (country) example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:destination of most recent travel (country) example

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (state/province/territory)
linkml description: The name of the province that was the destination of most recent travel.
examples: destination of most recent travel (state/province/territory) example
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the state/province/territory that the host travelled to. Use this look-up service to identify the standardized term: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

LABEL: destination of most recent travel (state/province/territory) example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:destination of most recent travel (state/province/territory) example

LABEL: diagnostic pcr Ct value 1
linkml description: The Ct value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the CT value of the sample from the diagnostic RT-PCR test.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr Ct value 2
linkml description: The Ct value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the CT value of the sample from the second diagnostic RT-PCR test.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr Ct value 3
linkml description: The Ct value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the CT value of the sample from the second diagnostic RT-PCR test.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr protocol 1
linkml description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
comments: Guidance: The name and version number of the protocol used for carrying out a diagnostic PCR test. This information can be compared to sequence data for evaluation of performance and quality control.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr protocol 2
linkml description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
comments: Guidance: The name and version number of the protocol used for carrying out a second diagnostic PCR test. This information can be compared to sequence data for evaluation of performance and quality control.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr protocol 3
linkml description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
comments: Guidance: The name and version number of the protocol used for carrying out a second diagnostic PCR test. This information can be compared to sequence data for evaluation of performance and quality control.

LABEL: environmental material
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: A substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment e.g. soil, water, sewage.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if an environmental material was sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template.  If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: environmental site
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. contact surface, metal can, hospital, wet market, bat cave.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide a descriptor if an environmental site was sampled. Use the picklist provided in the template.  If a desired term is missing from the picklist, contact emma.griffiths@bccdc.ca. If not applicable, do not leave blank. Choose a null value.

LABEL: exposure contact level
linkml description: The exposure transmission contact type.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select direct or indirect exposure from the pick-list.

LABEL: exposure details
linkml description: Additional host exposure information.
comments: Guidance: Free text description of the exposure.

LABEL: exposure event
linkml description: Event leading to exposure.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select an exposure event from the pick list provided in the template. If the desired term is missing, contact the curation team.

LABEL: exposure setting
linkml description: The setting leading to exposure.
comments: Guidance: Select the host exposure setting(s) from the pick list provided in the template. If a desired term is missing, contact the curation team.

LABEL: fast5 filename
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The user-specified filename of the FAST5 file.
comments: Guidance: Provide the FAST5 filename.

LABEL: fast5 filepath
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The location of the FAST5 file within a user's file system.
comments: Guidance: Provide the filepath for the FAST5 file. This information aids in data management.

LABEL: first dose vaccination date
linkml description: The date the host was first vaccinated.
comments: Guidance: Provide the vaccination date in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: flow cell barcode
linkml description: The barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing.
comments: Guidance: Provide the barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing the sample.

LABEL: GenBank/ENA/DDBJ accession
linkml description: The GenBank identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.
IAO definition: The GenBank identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from a GenBank submission (viral genome assembly).

LABEL: gene name 1
linkml description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the full name of the gene used in the test. The gene symbol (short form of gene name) can also be provided. Standardized gene names and symbols can be found in the Gene Ontology using this look-up service: https://bit.ly/2Sq1LbI

LABEL: gene name 2
linkml description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the full name of another gene used in an RT-PCR test. The gene symbol (short form of gene name) can also be provided. Standardized gene names and symbols can be found in the Gene Ontology using this look-up service: https://bit.ly/2Sq1LbI

LABEL: gene name 3
linkml description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the full name of another gene used in an RT-PCR test. The gene symbol (short form of gene name) can also be provided. Standardized gene names and symbols can be found in the Gene Ontology using this look-up service: https://bit.ly/2Sq1LbI

LABEL: geo_loc_name (city)
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The city where the sample was collected.
comments: Guidance: Provide the city name. Use this look-up service to identify the standardized term: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

LABEL: geo_loc_name (country)
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The country where the sample was collected.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the country name from the controlled vocabulary provided.

LABEL: geo_loc_name (state/province/territory)
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The province/territory where the sample was collected.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the province/territory name from the controlled vocabulary provided.

LABEL: GISAID accession
linkml description: The GISAID accession number assigned to the sequence.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from the GISAID submission.

LABEL: host (common name)
linkml description: The commonly used name of the host.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Common name or scientific name are required if there was a host. Both can be provided, if known. Use terms from the pick lists in the template. Common name e.g. human, bat. If the sample was environmental, put "not applicable".

LABEL: host (scientific name)
linkml description: The taxonomic, or scientific name of the host.
data_collection_state: 2021-06-06T01:15:53Z|Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Common name or scientific name are required if there was a host. Both can be provided, if known. Use terms from the pick lists in the template. Scientific name e.g. Homo sapiens, If the sample was environmental, put "not applicable".

LABEL: host age
linkml description: Age of host at the time of sampling.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Enter the age of the host in years. If not available, provide a null value. If there is not host, put "Not Applicable".

LABEL: host age bin
linkml description: Age of host at the time of sampling, expressed as an age group.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select the corresponding host age bin from the pick list provided in the template. If not available, provide a null value.

LABEL: host age unit
linkml description: The unit used to measure the host age, in either months or years.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Indicate whether the host age is in months or years. Age indicated in months will be binned to the 0 - 9 year age bin.

LABEL: host disease
linkml description: The name of the disease experienced by the host.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select \"COVID-19\" from the pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host gender
linkml description: The gender of the host at the time of sample collection.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select the corresponding host gender from the pick list provided in the template. If not available, provide a null value. If there is no host, put "Not Applicable"..

LABEL: host health outcome
linkml description: Disease outcome in the host.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: If known, select a descriptor from the pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host health state
linkml description: Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: If known, select a descriptor from the pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host health status details
linkml description: Further details pertaining to the health or disease status of the host at time of collection.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: If known, select a descriptor from the pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host residence geo_loc name (country)
linkml description: The country of residence of the host.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select the country name from pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host residence geo_loc name (state/province/territory)
linkml description: The state/province/territory of residence of the host.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select the province/territory name from pick list provided in the template.

LABEL: host role
linkml description: The role of the host in relation to the exposure setting.
comments: Guidance: Select the host's personal role(s) from the pick list provided in the template. If the desired term is missing, contact the curation team.

LABEL: host subject ID
linkml description: A unique identifier by which each host can be referred to e.g. #131
comments: Guidance: Provide the host identifier. Should be a unique, user-defined identifier.

LABEL: host vaccination status
linkml description: The vaccination status of the host (fully vaccinated, partially vaccinated, or not vaccinated).
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select the vaccination status of the host from the pick list.

LABEL: IRIDA sample name
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a sequenced isolate in IRIDA.
comments: Guidance: Store the IRIDA sample name. The IRIDA sample name will be created by the individual entering data into the IRIDA platform. IRIDA samples may be linked to metadata and sequence data, or just metadata alone. It is recommended that the IRIDA sample name be the same as, or contain, the specimen collector sample ID for better traceability. It is also recommended that the IRIDA sample name mirror the GISAID accession. IRIDA sample names cannot contain slashes. Slashes should be replaced by underscores. See IRIDA documentation for more information regarding special characters (https://irida.corefacility.ca/documentation/user/user/samples/#adding-a-new-sample).

LABEL: isolate
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: Identifier of the specific isolate.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide the GISAID virus name, which should be written in the format “hCov-19/CANADA/xxxxx/2020”.

LABEL: lab host
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: Name and description of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism or material from which the sample was obtained.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Type of cell line used for propagation. Provide the name of the cell line using the picklist in the template. If not passaged, put "Not Applicable"..

LABEL: last dose vaccination date
linkml description: The date the host received their last dose of vaccine.
comments: Guidance: Provide the date that the last dose of the vaccine was administered. Provide the last dose vaccination date in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: library ID
linkml description: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.
comments: Guidance: The library name should be unique, and can be an autogenerated ID from your LIMS, or modification of the isolate ID.

LABEL: library preparation kit
linkml description: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the library preparation kit used.

comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

Type: DataHarmonizer field - lineage and variant information
linkml description: The version of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.
comments: Guidance: Provide the version of the software used ot determine the lineage/clade.

LABEL: lineage/clade name
Type: DataHarmonizer field - lineage and variant information
linkml description: The name of the lineage or clade.
comments: Guidance: Provide the Pangolin or Nextstrain lineage/clade name.

linkml description: The name of the antiviral treatment agent administered during the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.
examples: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment agent example
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the antiviral treatment agent administered during the most recent prior infection. If no treatment was administered, put \"No treatment\". If multiple antiviral agents were administered, list them all separated by commas.

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment agent example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment agent example

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment date
linkml description: The date treatment was first administered during the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.
examples: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment date example
comments: Guidance: Provide the date that the antiviral treatment agent was first administered during the most recenrt prior infection. Provide the prior SARS-CoV-2 treatment date in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment date example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment date example

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 infection
linkml description: Whether there was prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: If known, provide information about whether the individual had a previous SARS-CoV-2 infection. Select a value from the pick list.

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 infection date
linkml description: The date of diagnosis of the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.
comments: Guidance: Provide the date that the most recent prior infection was diagnosed. Provide the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection date in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: prior SARS-CoV-2 infection isolate
linkml description: The identifier of the isolate found in the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.
comments: Guidance: Provide the isolate name of the most recent prior infection. Structure the \"isolate\" name to be ICTV/INSDC compliant in the following format: \"SARS-CoV-2/host/country/sampleID/date\".

LABEL: purpose of sampling
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The reason that the sample was collected.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: The reason a sample was collected may provide information about potential biases in sampling strategy. Provide the purpose of sampling from the picklist in the template. Most likely, the sample was collected for Diagnostic testing. The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing, which should be indicated in the \"purpose of sequencing\" field.

LABEL: purpose of sampling details
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The description of why the sample was collected, providing specific details.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was collected using free text. The description may include the importance of the sample for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. If details are not available, provide a null value.

LABEL: purpose of sampling details example
value: The sample was collected to investigate the prevalence of variants associated with mink-to-human transmission in Canada.

LABEL: purpose of sequencing
linkml description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing. The reason a sample was sequenced may provide information about potential biases in sequencing strategy. Provide the purpose of sequencing from the picklist in the template. The reason for sample collection should be indicated in the \"purpose of sampling\" field.

LABEL: purpose of sequencing details
linkml description: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was sequenced using free text. The description may include the importance of the sequences for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. Suggested standardized descriotions include: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout), Screened for mink variants, Screened for B.1.1.7 variant, Screened for B.1.135 variant, Screened for P.1 variant, Screened due to travel history, Screened due to close contact with infected individual, Assessing public health control measures, Determining early introductions and spread, Investigating airline-related exposures, Investigating temporary foreign worker, Investigating remote regions, Investigating health care workers, Investigating schools/universities, Investigating reinfection.

LABEL: purpose of sequencing details example
value: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout)

LABEL: r1 fastq filename
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The user-specified filename of the r1 FASTQ file.
comments: Guidance: Provide the r1 FASTQ filename.

LABEL: r1 fastq filepath
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The location of the r1 FASTQ file within a user's file system.
comments: Guidance: Provide the filepath for the r1 FASTQ file. This information aids in data management.

LABEL: r2 fastq filename
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The user-specified filename of the r2 FASTQ file.
comments: Guidance: Provide the r2 FASTQ filename.

LABEL: r2 fastq filepath
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The location of the r2 FASTQ file within a user's file system.
comments: Guidance: Provide the filepath for the r2 FASTQ file. This information aids in data management.

LABEL: raw sequence data processing method
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: The names of the software and version number used for raw data processing such as removing barcodes, adapter trimming, filtering etc.
comments: Guidance: Provide the software name followed by the version e.g. Trimmomatic v. 0.38, Porechop v. 0.2.3

LABEL: raw sequence data processing method example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:raw sequence data processing method example

LABEL: reference genome accession
Type: DataHarmonizer field - bioinformatics and QC metrics
linkml description: A persistent, unique identifier of a genome database entry.
comments: Guidance: Provide the accession number of the reference genome.

LABEL: sample collected by
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The name of the agency that collected the original sample.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: The name of the sample collector should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multple submissions e.g. Public Health Agency of Canada, Public Health Ontario, BC Centre for Disease Control. The sample collector specified is at the discretion of the data provider (i.e. may be hospital, provincial public health lab, or other).

LABEL: sample collection date
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The date on which the sample was collected.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Sample collection date is critical for surveillance and many types of analyses. Required granularity includes year, month and day. If this date is considered identifiable information, it is acceptable to add \"jitter\" by adding or subtracting a calendar day (acceptable by GISAID). Alternatively, ”received date” may be used as a substitute. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: sample collection date precision
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The precision to which the \"sample collection date\" was provided.
comments: Guidance: Provide the precision of granularity to the \"day\", \"month\", or \"year\" for the date provided in the \"sample collection date\" field. The \"sample collection date\" will be truncated to the precision specified upon export; \"day\" for \"YYYY-MM-DD\", \"month\" for \"YYYY-MM\", or \"year\" for \"YYYY\".

LABEL: sample collector contact address
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
comments: Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, Province/Territory, Postal Code, Country.

LABEL: sample collector contact address example
value: 655 Lab St, Vancouver, British Columbia, V5N 2A2, Canada

LABEL: sample collector contact email
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
comments: Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or lab e.g. johnnyblogs@lab.ca, or RespLab@lab.ca.

LABEL: sample received date
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The date on which the sample was received.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: ISO 8601 standard \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: sequence submitted by
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multple submissions. If submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the \"National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)\".

LABEL: sequence submitter contact address
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sequence.
comments: Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, Province/Territory, Postal Code, Country

LABEL: sequence submitter contact address example
value: 123 Sunnybrooke St, Toronto, Ontario, M4P 1L6, Canada

LABEL: sequence submitter contact email
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
comments: Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or lab e.g. johnnyblogs@lab.ca, or RespLab@lab.ca.

LABEL: sequencing date
linkml description: The date the sample was sequenced.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: ISO 8601 standard \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: sequencing instrument
linkml description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select a sequencing instrument from the picklist provided in the template.

LABEL: sequencing kit number
linkml description: The manufacturer's kit number.
comments: Guidance: Alphanumeric value.

LABEL: sequencing protocol
linkml description: The protocol used to generate the sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide a free text description of the methods and materials used to generate the sequence. Suggested text, fill in information where indicated. e.g. "Viral sequencing was performed following a tiling amplicon strategy using the <fill in> primer scheme. Sequencing was performed using a <fill in> sequencing instrument. Libraries were prepared using <fill in> library kit."

LABEL: sequencing protocol
linkml description: The protocol used to generate the sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide a free text description of the methods and materials used to generate the sequence. Suggested text, fill in information where indicated.: \"Viral sequencing was performed following a tiling amplicon strategy using the <fill in> primer scheme. Sequencing was performed using a <fill in> sequencing instrument. Libraries were prepared using <fill in> library kit.\"

LABEL: sequencing protocol example
value: Genomes were generated through amplicon sequencing of 1200 bp amplicons with Freed schema primers. Libraries were created using Illumina DNA Prep kits, and sequence data was produced using Miseq Micro v2 (500 cycles) sequencing kits.

LABEL: sequencing protocol name
linkml description: The name and version number of the sequencing protocol used.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version of the sequencing protocol e.g. 1D_DNA_MinION

LABEL: signs and symptoms
linkml description: A perceived change in function or sensation, (loss, disturbance or appearance) indicative of a disease, reported by a patient or clinician.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select all of the symptoms experienced by the host from the pick list.

LABEL: specimen collector sample ID
linkml description: The user-defined name for the sample.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Store the collector sample ID. If this number is considered identifiable information, provide an alternative ID. Be sure to store the key that maps between the original and alternative IDs for traceability and follow up if necessary. Every collector sample ID from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab.

LABEL: specimen processing
Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
linkml description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Critical for interpreting data. Select all the applicable processes from the pick list. If virus was passaged, include information in \"lab host\", \"passage number\", and \"passage method\" fields. If none of the processes in the pick list apply, put "Not Applicable"..

LABEL: SRA accession
linkml description: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted \"run\". NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR.

LABEL: symptom onset date
linkml description: The date on which the symptoms began or were first noted.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: ISO 8601 standard \"YYYY-MM-DD\".

LABEL: third party lab sample ID
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a sample by a third party service provider.
examples: third party lab sample ID example
comments: Guidance: Store the identifier supplied by the third party for the sample.

LABEL: third party lab sample ID example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:third party lab sample ID example

LABEL: third party lab service provider name
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:third party lab service provider name
linkml description: The name of the third party company or laboratory that provided services.
examples: third party lab service provider name example
comments: Guidance: Store the sample identifier supplied by the third party services provider.

LABEL: third party lab service provider name example
Alternative LABEL: CanCOGeN:third party lab service provider name example

LABEL: travel history
linkml description: Travel history in last six months.
comments: Guidance: Specify the countries (and more granular locations if known, separated by a comma) travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels. Separate multiple travel events with a semi-colon. List most recent travel first.

LABEL: travel history example
value: Canada, Vancouver; USA, Seattle; Italy, Milan

LABEL: umbrella bioproject accession
linkml description: The INSDC accession number assigned to the umbrella BioProject for the Canadian SARS-CoV-2 sequencing effort.
comments: Guidance: Store the umbrella BioProject accession by selecting it from the picklist in the template. The umbrella BioProject accession will be identical for all CanCOGen submitters. Different provinces will have their own BioProjects, however these BioProjects will be linked under one umbrella BioProject.

LABEL: vaccine name
linkml description: The name of the vaccine.
comments: Guidance: Free text. Provide the name of the vaccine.

LABEL: variant designation
Type: DataHarmonizer field - lineage and variant information
linkml description: The variant classification of the lineage/clade i.e. variant, variant of concern.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: If the lineage/clade is considered a Variant of Concern, select Variant of Concern from the pick list. If the lineage/clade contains mutations of concern (mutations that increase transmission, clincal severity, or other epidemiological fa ctors) but it not a global Variant of Concern, select Variant. If the lineage/clade does not contain mutations of concern, leave blank.

LABEL: variant evidence
Type: DataHarmonizer field - lineage and variant information
linkml description: The evidence used to make the variant determination.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access
comments: Guidance: Select whether the sample was screened using RT-qPCR or by sequencing from the pick list.

LABEL: variant evidence details
Type: DataHarmonizer field - lineage and variant information
linkml description: Details about the evidence used to make the variant determination.
comments: Guidance: Provide the assay and list the set of lineage-defining mutations used to make the variant determination. If there are mutations of interest/concern observed in addition to lineage-defining mutations, describe those here.

LABEL: variant evidence details example
value: Lineage-defining mutations: ORF1ab (K1655N), Spike (K417N, E484K, N501Y, D614G, A701V), N (T205I), E (P71L).
